channel.title: Cashin's Conundrums
channel.description: Trivia questions pulled from Cashin's Comments.

item.title: February 13th, 2020
item.description: Today's Question - An old Sr. Partner decided to really test a hotshot job applicant. He said - "My son is 24 years younger than I am. My grandson is 25 years younger than my son. My age plus my grandson's age equals 73 years. If you want the job tell me how old I am." Well?? NO COMMENTS FRIDAY

item.title: February 12th, 2020
item.description: Today's Question - What's my handicap - Bob and Ross ran a race of 100 yards. Bob won by 10 yards. Ross proposed they race again but Bob should start 10 yards back. Thus Bob had to run 110 yards while Ross ran 100. All things being equal - who won?

item.title: February 11th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - Work smarter not harder - If 6 people can paint 9 landscapes in a day and a half.....how many people would it take to paint 270 landscapes in 30 days?

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - It would take 9 painters to paint 270 landscapes in 30 days. (If six painters paint 9 landscapes in a day and a half, they paint 6 in 1 day or 1 per day per painter.)

Doesn't match      Missing info      Like question

item.title: February 10th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - It was for a good cause anyway – With a break in the artic chill, half the floor turned out to watch a charity mini-marathon. The runners were Mike, Pete, Rich, Dan and Ed. Mike finished in front of Pete but behind Rich. Dan finished in front of Ed but behind Pete. What was the order of finish?

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - The order of finish was Rich, Mike, Pete, Dan and Ed.

Doesn't match      Missing info      Like question

item.title: February 6th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - Around the water cooler there was a great debate about who made the best calzone - a meat and cheese filled baked item. They agreed to each bring samples Tuesday. Sam brought some. Jack brought one more than that. Harry brought one more than Jack. Bob missed his train and showed up empty handed. He said he'd pay for his share. The four of them split the 12 calzones evenly. They figured each calzone was worth a dollar. Who paid what to whom? NO COMMENTS FRIDAY

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - For there to be 12 calzones, Sam must have brought 3; Jack 4; and Harry 5. Divided equally (3 pies apiece) that meant Bob paid $3 - $1 to Jack and $2 to Harry.

item.title: February 5th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - What two well-known five letter words end in "y" but do not contain "A,E,I,O, or U"?

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - The two well-known five letter words that end in "Y" but have no regular vowels are: Pygmy and Gypsy."

Doesn't match      Missing info      Like question

item.title: February 4th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - In a small county election there were four candidates: Larry, Charles, Sal and Ivan. The total votes cast were 8,341. Larry won beating Sal by 560 votes, beating Charles by 830 and Ivan by 981. How many votes did each candidate get?

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - To find how many votes each one got take the total vote (1841) and add each of the spreads between the winner and each loser (560 + 830 + 981). That total (10712) would be the votes cast if the others had tied Larry. Now divide by 4 to find out how many votes Larry got (2678). Now subtract the spreads in the question, giving: Sal = 2118; Charles = 1848; and Ivan 1697.

item.title: January 30th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - You recall the old children's code of substituting a number for a letter. Well here is the opposite - each letter represents a number. Can you solve this addition problem? (Remember if M = 6, it must always = 6) STIR TWO WHEAT NO COMMENTS FRIDAY Cashin’s Comments January 30, 2020 Page 3 of 3

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - To get his $7,500 Nelson would have sold: 3 jade; 1494 amber; and 503 porcelain.

item.title: January 29th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - How old are you? Two people are comparing ages. Bob is three times as old as Bill. But in two years Bob will only be twice as old as Bill. How old is each??

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - Bob would be 6 years old while Bill is 2. In two years it will be 8 and 4.

item.title: January 28th, 2020
item.description:
Today's Question - "Don't hold dinner dear!" Timothy can't get his car started so he grabs a train, which takes him halfway home at a speed 20 times faster than he walks. As he gets off the train, he twists his ankle and must ride the rest of the way in a farmers cart which travels half as fast as he walks. Would he have been home sooner or later if he had walked all the way. (You don't need a calculator.)

Reveal Answer Corner Answer - No Algebra needed. If the farmers cart took Timothy half the distance at half the speed of walking, that took as much time as walking the whole way, so the train trip was wasted.
